tool_description: The comprehensive range of APIs available within this project empowers you to deliver notifications to individuals in your customer database through diverse channels. These notifications can be sent in various formats, including text messages via WhatsApp and SMS, as well as through voice-based communication methods. This flexibility ensures that you can effectively reach your customers through their preferred communication channels, enhancing the overall engagement and user experience.
name: WhatsApp, SMS & Voice
title: WhatsApp, SMS & Voice

api_list.name: WhatsApp
api_list.description:
Below are the definitions of the fields required for the API to work:

"content": This field represents the content of the notification you want to send through the API. 

"contact":  The contact field specifies the phone number or contact information of the recipient to whom the notification will be sent.  The format should be as follows 212xxxxxxxxx

"owner": The owner field identifies the owner or sender of the notification. This is the email you used to sign up for the product on jaarvis.io

"deviceId": This is the ID of your device on the Jaarvis platform

"mediaPath": The mediaPath field is used to specify the path or URL of any media content that you want to include in the notification. It could be a picture or an mp4 video that does notexceed 4mb.

To use this JSON object as a payload for a POST request API, you would typically pass it as the request body in your HTTP POST request. The API endpoint should be set to the appropriate URL for the notification service, and you should ensure that you provide valid values for the "content", "contact", and "owner" fields, as these are likely required fields for the notification to be successfully sent. If the "deviceId" and "mediaPath" fields are optional for the API, you can include them in the request payload as needed.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whatsapp-sms-voice.p.rapidapi.com/message/sendMsgToContact"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whatsapp-sms-voice.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://whatsapp-sms-voice.p.rapidapi.com/message/sendMsgToContact"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whatsapp-sms-voice.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
